pullRequest.title: Do not specify exercise dates in exam exercises
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.

Motivation and Context
It is cumbersome and error prone to set all exercise dates (release, due, assessment due) for exams correctly.
Also students with individual working times cannot be reflected which is a problem.
It makes more sense to simply ignore these exercises dates and set them to null to prevent inconsistencies or other issues.
Exams should
Description
Instructors cannot set these dates any more when creating or editing exercises for exams.

Do not allow users to specify exercise dates in exam exercises
Always use the specified exam dates instead

exam start date --> release date
exam end date (individual) --> due date
exam result publication date --> assessment due date


Always set exercise dates in exam exercises to null
Also allow to specify assessment due date in programming exercises

Basically refactoring to go through the usage of all the dates in exercise in the current codebase and see if it needs to be adapted to support exam exercises (where all the dates are null)
Open in the implementation:

 Make sure that students can still submit all exercise types in their (personal) exam working time
 Make sure the assessment works, when the exercise dates are null
 Check that all tests are running properly (some might need to be adapted)

Known issues/open points to do in follow-up:

allow to specify assessment due date in programming exercises
fix tutor-exercise-dashboard leaderboard and side-panel
make sure that tutors cannot assess submissions with no result (first assessment) after the result release date

Steps for Testing

Create an exam with text, modeling, quiz and programming exercises (try out create, edit and import)
If possible, double check that release date, due date and assessment due date are set to null in the database
Participate as student in the exam and make sure you can submit until the end of the individual working time without any issues
Participate as tutor in the assessment of the exam. This should also work without any problems after the end date of the exam (or more precise the latest individual end date of all students). The Tutor Exam Dashboard will be visible after the latest individual end date.
After the result release date, a tutor should not be able to override his assessment (403 error should be thrown)

Please also review the code properly, there were some major refactoring for the AssessmentResource and AssessmentService

nodes.bodyText: I'm not sure, but should this really depend on the last individual end date and not on the one belonging to the StudentExam to which the result belongs?

I'm not sure if that's a problem, but what would happen if isExamMode is true and exercise.dueDate is null?
Then this would also be null here.

nodes.bodyText:
We are basically already holding this information in the exam variable, I'm not sure if it makes sense to make isExamMode a method that checks if exam is not null.
But I believe thats a minor issue as the values are only set once if I see it correctly.

nodes.bodyText: The current implementation is consistent with the regular assessment on Artemis.
While this seems to be a correct implementation, it is hard to follow that this method does a useful check for non-exam exercises. See further comment in ExamSubmissionService.

I am wondering if this is the correct place for this method. I would prefer this to be part of a exam independent service.
The way this is currently used makes it hard to understand that this method does have relevance for non-exam exercises if not reading the comment (which I found hard to understand).

Spaces on Purpose? Suggested change
  • Exam End Date : {{ exam?.endDate | artemisDate }}
  • Publish Results Date : {{ exam?.publishResultsDate | artemisDate }}
  • Exam End Date : {{ exam?.endDate | artemisDate }}
  • Publish Results Date : {{ exam?.publishResultsDate | artemisDate }}
